channel.title: Models.dat, models.idx

item.title: Models.dat, models.idx
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

This .dat file is packed with all the models for the client or something, I don’t understand entirely how it works but I’m curious about something.

Is there a way I can pull out individual models and repack it? It has all the models I need, but some are corrupt or not very appealing, but everything else is great. I’d like to remove a specific model and then repack them all to work in the same way.

I’ve tried the cache suite, but I don’t think it notices the file.

If anyone’s interested in how to do this, here’s the solution. This can be very useful if you’re trying to extract specific models.

Add this in ModelDecompressor.

	public static final void writeFile(String s, byte data[]) {
		try
		{
			File a = new File(s);
			FileOutputStream fileoutputstream = new FileOutputStream(s);
			fileoutputstream.write(data, 0, data.length);
			fileoutputstream.close();
		}
		catch (Exception e)
		{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

Underneath,

dataFile.readFully(data);

in the loadModels method, add this.

	writeFile("DIRECTORY_HERE" + Integer.toString(id) + ".dat", data);
	System.out.println("File written");

This will write all the models from the compressed file to a specified location.

If you’re only after a specific model, you can just add an if statement to write the one model

if (id == 5000) {
...
}

Read full topic
